intro: Holcus annuus subsp. duriensis, commonly known as the Duriensis Meadowgrass, is a perennial grass species native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in moist, grassy habitats such as meadows and wetlands, preferring well-drained soils. The plant has narrow, flat leaves with a distinct midrib and produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny flowers. It is characterized by its robust growth habit and ability to thrive in temperate climates. Due to its ecological importance, it is often found in conservation areas and is valued for its role in supporting local biodiversity.
